title: Hamiltonicity of Cartesian products of graphs
authors:
Irena Hrastnik Ladinek, \v{Z}ana Kovijani\'c Vuki\'cevi\'c, Tja\v{s}a
  Paj Erker, Simon \v{S}pacapan
abstract:
A path factor in a graph $G$ is a factor of $G$ in which every component is a
path on at least two vertices. Let $T\Box P_n$ be the Cartesian product of a
tree $T$ and a path on $n$ vertices. Kao and Weng proved that $T\Box P_n$ is
hamiltonian if $T$ has a path factor, $n$ is an even integer and $n\geq 4\Delta
(T)-2$. They conjectured that for every $\Delta \geq 3$ there exists a graph
$G$ of maximum degree $\Delta$ which has a path factor, such that for every
even $n< 4\Delta-2$ the product $G\Box P_n$ is not hamiltonian. In this article
we prove this conjecture.
